title: 113_hr4410
content: The Act is titled the "DoD Laboratory Authorities for Breakthrough Scientific Research Act" or the "DoD LABS Research Act." It allows employees of defense laboratories to travel to technical symposiums or conferences if approved by the head of the laboratory. Additionally, qualified students can be included in certain positions at Department of Defense research and engineering facilities. Section 1107(a)(1) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2014 is amended to allow the director of Science and Technology Reinvention Laboratories to appoint qualified candidates to scientific and engineering positions without certain restrictions. The National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2014 allows the director of Science and Technology Reinvention Laboratories to appoint qualified candidates to scientific and engineering positions without certain restrictions. A qualified candidate is defined as an individual with a bachelor's degree or a student enrolled in a program leading to a bachelor's or master's degree in a STEM field at an institution of higher education. SEC. 4. ASSESSMENT OF CERTAIN DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE HIRING PRACTICES. The Secretary of Defense must submit a report to Congress on the Department of Defense's use of specific hiring authorities within 180 days of this Act's enactment. The report will cover various hiring authorities, including those related to highly qualified experts and the Intergovernmental Personnel Act. The report required by the Secretary of Defense to Congress within 180 days of this Act's enactment must include a description of the implementation and use of hiring authorities within the Department of Defense, along with recommendations for improvements and adjustments to better suit the needs of each Defense laboratory. The hiring authorities may be extended beyond the sunset date provided in the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2014. Permanent authority for experimental personnel program for scientific and technical personnel. The Strom Thurmond National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 1999 is amended to remove subsections (e) and (f) and make technical and conforming amendments to the experimental personnel program for scientific and technical personnel. The Strom Thurmond National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 1999 is amended by redesignating subsection (g) as subsection (e) and removing the phrase "in which the authority under this section is in effect" from subsection (e).
